item.title: T-Mobile G1 Google Android Phone Gets Vocal
item.description:
Choosing your next smartphone can be tough. Touchscreen phones like Apple’s iPhone, the BlackBerry Bold, and Samsung Delve are appealing, but some prefer a physical QWERTY keyboard. The BlackBerry Pearl’s trackball navigation is another option. Connectivity matters too, with 3G being desirable but not always accessible. WiFi capability for fast web browsing is also important. The HTC-built G1 for T-Mobile might be the solution if you want it all. This “Android Phone,” marking Google’s entry into mobile wireless, operates on T-Mobile’s network, offering quad-band service and various data features...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t-mobile-g1-google-android-phone-gets-vocal/
